required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Intermediate and High Intensity Regimens in Patients With Relapsed Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Intermediate and High Intensity Regimens in Patients With Relapsed Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia. Experience of Two Centers in Mexico City

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to describe the survival and relapses of patients with diagnosis of acute lymphoblastic leukemia at two tertiary level hospitals in the metropolitan area of the valley of Mexico

detailed_description.textblock: Retrospective, observational study in patients with diagnosis of acute lymphoblastic leukemia, according to the criteria of the World Health Organization, from July, 2016, to October, 2020. The patients were cared for in the hematology department of the Hospital General de Mexico and in the hematology department of the Hospital Regional de Alta Especialidad Ixtapaluca. Relapse was considered in those cases with more than 5% of blasts in bone marrow and as relapse to the central nervous system with the presence of blasts in cerebrospinal fluid.

primary_outcome.description: Cases with more than 5 percent of blasts in bone marrow and as relapse to the central nervous system with the presence of blasts in cerebrospinal fluid

study_pop.textblock: Patients with first diagnosis of acute lymphoblastic leukemia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with diagnosis of acute lymphoblastic leukemia according to the criteria of the World Health Organization.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age less than 15 years
- Age over 60 years

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital General de México Dr. Eduardo Liceaga

facility.name: Hospital Regional de Alta Especialidad de Ixtapaluca
Hospital General de México "Dr. Eduardo Liceaga"

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of the hematology hospitalization area
